description: Buy the Thule Helium Pro Bike Rack - 3 Bike online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Helium Pro Bike Rack - 3 Bike
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Helium Pro Bike Rack - 3 Bike online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I was looking for a light bike rack that I could easily install and take off by myself.  The Helium delivers against this objective.  It is very light weight and easy to manage.  The bike(s) seem secure.  The only issue, which is minor, is related to the strap.  I assume the primary purpose is to keep the front wheel from swaying/moving.  The strap is too long, especially when only hauling one bike.  Three short (1 for each bike) would be far more manageable.  Again, this is a small point and overall I am very happy with the product.
review.name: Mission Accomplished - Light Weight Rack

review.reviewBody: Overall design i think is good, but the ratcheting straps, as others have noted, are TERRIBLE. I spent 45 minutes trying to get them off. They were not overtightened, just snug, but the tab you push down doesn't go far enough to liberate the ratchets. This strikes me as the easiest part to engineer, but they flubbed this one big time.
review.name: Thule missed the easy part

review.reviewBody: Works perfectly for three bikes, highly recommend!
review.name: Secure, safe, & rad looking

review.reviewBody: I have a Saris two bike hitch rack, which worked great but was very heavy and cumbersome to install on my 2 inch receiver. I wanted something more lightweight for my solo rides. The aluminum hitch rack is great; well engineered. The supports tilt down out-of-the-way when your bike is not mounted, and the vertical part can tilt away from your SUV so the hatchback can open, which are all nice features. Also, there is a significant weight savings which I appreciate. I had read the reviews prior to purchase and realize there were numerous complaints over the straps. This is all true. The straps are suboptimal. They tend to jam, especially the one that goes around the seat post. I think the key is to keep them lined up perfectly and not tighten them on any sort of angle. If they get jammed, they’re extremely difficult to remove. I could  foresee a situation where you may need to actually cut one. I guess that’s why they sell strap kit separately. I think Thule should do their homework and design a better system that will be retrofitted to the existing racks that are out there.  Sort of a shame to let the crummy straps take the luster off of an otherwise great bike rack.
review.name: Great lightweight bike rack, but straps need work.

review.reviewBody: Overall the structure , stability and good performance of the system is a good indicator of the quality materials used to make it .
review.name: Nice structure and looking

review.reviewBody:
We've had a Helium rack for about 5 years. Easy to install and remove. Holds bike firmly.
The only issue is the rubber straps deteriorate over time, but are fairly easy to replace.
review.name: Great Rack

review.reviewBody: Light, strong, well made, lockable... Everything I was looking for...
review.name: Great specs!

review.reviewBody: Great bike rack , easy to put on and take off . Love the locks so can’t steal rack or bikes . Super fast delivery.
review.name: Awesome Bike Rack

review.reviewBody: We had no choice but to replace a Helium 2 due to a broken part that Thule could not replace. The new model is higher and has a better hitch mechanism, but has awful ratchet straps instead of the very easy to use rubber straps. Why the dumb redesign I don’t know.
review.name: Redesigned and not better
comment:
I'm sorry to hear the Thule Helium Pro did not meet your expectations. 
The updated ratcheting straps allow for a more bike-specific fit and are more resistant to wear and damage than rubber cradle straps.

review.reviewBody: I recently purchased the Helium Pro Three to transport our two bikes. I went with the three bike version vs. the two bike version to allow a bit more space between the two bikes. This rack is super! I have a factory 2" receiver on my Jeep and the rack works beautifully. It's light but extremely sturdy and well constructed. Everything works as it should. It was a worthwhile purchase. In this world today, you get what you pay for. You buy cheap, eventually you replace cheap. If you do your research and buy quality products and take care of your purchase, you will be satisfied for a very long time.
review.name: This rack is just right!

name: Helium Pro Bike Rack - 3 Bike

hasVariant.description: Buy the Crank Brothers Stamp 3 V2 Pedals online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Replacing 3 yr old Stamp 1 Gen 2. They were good and solid.
But these things! It is not possible to slide my Adidas off the pedals.
It takes a twist to release the sole. I'm not sure how it works but my feet are attached to the pedals!
review.name: Who needs to clip in?

review.reviewBody: Classic, no nonsense, and durable. Crank brothers excel at making what should be simple also effective. We each have different sizes (hers are actually the Stamp 2 but all this applies). Good weight/balance, pegs are holding up well so far, looks good on my Tallboy and her Furtado.
review.name: I love mine, wife loves hers too

review.reviewBody:
I use Stamp small pedals on my mountain bike and on my gravel bike. With 5 10 shoes the stamps make great contact. Even though the pedal is sold as a small it provides full contact for my foot. The pins allow me to feel glued to the pedal and if I need to I can move my foot a bit by unweighting.
The Stamps are light and easy to use.
PS In the winter I just changed over to boots for warmth. Even though the boots are much bigger than my bike shoes the small pedals provide a perfect platform for good contact and grip.
I have used these pedals for 50 rides
review.name: Stamp V 2 small pedals

review.reviewBody: These look more gray in person than they do on the pictures on the site. They are great pedals and much slimmer and sleeker than the stamp3 V1 pedal. It might be 2 or 3 mm thinner than the old pedal, which surprisingly reduces pedal strikes significantly. This is my current favorite pedal because the platform is so large and I never slip off.
review.name: I wish they came in black
comment: I think what he was getting at was that the black color offered is more of a charcoal than a true black.
They do have a black version.

name: Stamp 3 V2 Pedals

hasVariant.name: Boomslang Platform Pedals
hasVariant.description: Buy the Specialized Boomslang Platform Pedals online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Big platform, grips like youre clipped in. Very comfortable and take a battering. The bearings need a lot of care and you need proprietary tools to take them apart, which is a bit annoying.
review.name: Heavy duty pedals

review.reviewBody: No markings L or R and due to bad design no double ring on left pedal. When  installed on a crank with a boot pedal doesn't spin. Fit is very very tight. Not enough space between pedal body and crank. It was main reason for return. By today standard pedal is heavy. I was not even aware about special tool needed for servicing. Another reason to staying away.
review.name: Stay away

review.reviewBody: I originally had these before I switched to clipless pedals and loved them.  When I purchased and enduro bike earlier this year, I decided to use flat pedals and went back to the Boomslangs.  The shape of the pins really digs into your shoes to create excellent grip.  I've tried other flat pedals and didn't feel like they had as much grip as these do.  I like that there are extra pins stored on the pedals themselves, even though I haven't had to replace any yet.  The platform is large and sturdy but the width is low profile.  I rarely pedal strike, even on steep technical terrain.
review.name: My favorite flat pedals!

name: Boomslang Platform Pedals

The shoulder straps are flimsy and painful when using as a backpack. 2. awkward to carry with one hand ( weight distribution is weirdly off. 3. no back support when in backpack mode. 4. absolutely needs a strap to connect the shoulder straps in the middle when being used as a backpack. almost dropped bag several times while using like a backpack. My other Northface backpacks have a secure strap. 5. lastly missing water bottle pockets. This will probably be my last duffel bag from Northface.
review.name: Should have listened to the reviews!!!!!!!

review.reviewBody: fits so much and my husband really liked this gift! uses it for everyday gym and for travel. although it looks big, fits underneath plane seat so you can use it as a carry on!

review.reviewBody:
I really like these as a casual overshirt or flannel alternative.  The material is a lightweight ripstop poly-cotton, and it's quite breathable but has a nice heft to it.  I typically wear them open over a t-shirt or light henley; the fit is a bit boxy through the midsection, as are most work shirts, but they look good open or with the top couple of buttons open over a layer.  No, other reviewers, it does not work as anything but a casual work shirt; it looks like workwear, not anything business- or smart casual.  

Issues? The wrists are quite tight but I usually wear the sleeves rolled, so this doesn't bother me but it might you, if you wear shirt sleeves rolled down and have thick wrists or big hands.  On sale, I can forgive some slight fit issues.
review.name: burly but lightweight overshirt

description: Buy the Topeak JoeBlow Pro Digital Floor Pump online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: JoeBlow Pro Digital Floor Pump
hasVariant.description: Buy the Topeak JoeBlow Pro Digital Floor Pump online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Batteries have to be either easy to replace and short-lived OR could be harder to replace and long-lived. These batteries die fast and are terrible to replace.

After the battery died in only 6 months of use, my first attempt to replace the battery resulted in the hidden fastening nuts being stripped (using the correct tool, 1.5mm Allen). Most expensive tire inflations I’ve ever done with this disposable pump I guess.

From others' equally negative reviews, it seems that many people have this or a similar issue. If they do manage to remove that cover plate, it looks like it's still very difficult to figure out how to replace the batteries.

100% stay away from this terrible, flawed product. This will last shorter than the absolute cheapest pump you can buy anywhere. Disgraceful.
review.name: Disposable due to Critical Design Flaws

name: JoeBlow Pro Digital Floor Pump

hasVariant.description: Buy the Osprey Packs Duro 15L Hydration Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Disappointed is the word I’m looking for. I give 2 stars as Osprey did hold their word on replacing my old duro under warranty. When I recieved this one, the first thing I noticed is how much smaller the pack is in comparison to the previous. Barely able to carry a puffer jacket and winter hat. As well as lack of internal pockets which I relied on a lot to use this pack for versatility. The side zip access for the hydro pack makes accessibility easier, but it’s also more potential for damage. I feel like this redesign was to prevent people from using the pack for multiple activities outside of ultra, forcing you to buy a larger pack for anything that may require carrying more gear. As a striving minimalist, osprey really disappointed me with this change as it follows the corporate consumption path other brands have adopted over the years. My last pack lasted 3 year with lots of use. So let’s see how long this one lasts, but given the changes, there will be less activities the pack will be used for.
review.name: Disappointed is the word I’m

review.reviewBody: I really want this bag to work for me, and it does in the wintertime when I wear more layers, but in the summer, when I only wear a t-shirt, it injures my back. I’m 6’3” and it rides high and causes my shirts to rise up. Then the part of the bag where the reservoir hose meets the bag rubs on my exposed lower back and I’m bleeding even after a mere 5k. Not sure how to fix this, but I think the bag is simply designed too small.
review.name: Too short, hurts my back in summer

review.reviewBody:
I really like this pack for my 10-20mi long day hikes. Although a tight fit, I can pack the following in it; Grayl Geo Press 24oz, Solar power bank, Fido Pro Airlift sling for my service dog, first aid kit, sunscreen, bug spray, headlamp, plenty of protein bars, snacks for my service dog, she is a German Shepherd so quite a bit actually, collapsible water bowl, electrolytes pouches, 2 water bottles, iPhone 11 Pro Max, and car keys. Plus the included 2.5L water reservoir. It’s a lot to squeeze into a 15L pack, but it works. 

The fit is very comfortable. You barely notice it even when fully packed. The quality seems to be good. I have worn it several times now and I haven’t had any issues with on the Appalachian Trail. I highly recommend it.
review.name: Great for day hiking and trail running

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] So far so good. It fits quite snuggly. Still experience a bit of jump while running in it, but mostly due to water bladder. I need to work on adjustments inside the bag to secure the bladder and prevent it from jumping. Overall, happy with the bag. True test coming up- 100km trail run!
review.name: So far so good. It

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have the M/L and it's a little short for my torso (I'm 5-11); the hip belt is more of a belly belt and if I tighten it the shoulder straps (at their longest) hurt my neck after a couple of hours. the water sloshes a bit too, even with no air in the bag-- I also have a Talon and the water bag doesn't slosh in that. otherwise it seems to be great and looks like it can hold a lot of gear.
review.name: I have the M/L and

review.reviewBody:
I totally agree with "Disabled G." I prefer the prior model by far, which had much better storage options and a better hydration storage design. I didn't realize the design had changed when I ordered my new one. It's going back and I'll have to hunt for a better option. 
Osprey, you've been my go-to brand for many years, but this was a mistake. Please fix this!
review.name: Old model far better!

review.reviewBody: This pack Is horrible. There isn't even the same amount of storage as the old model they claim it's the same but it's nowhere near the storage capacity of the old model the new water bladder pocket zipper is horrible. It just falls down. Everything is mesh the storage pocket where the key goes is so small now it's a joke make a real pack off spray like the last model. Is this new one sucks I'll be selling this one online and looking for the old model what is wrong with osprey now are you guys cutting corners. Absolutely horrible
review.name: Osprey please remake last model this new one is horrible

name: Duro 15L Hydration Backpack

review.reviewBody: An MTB shoe that is great when the temps are between 25 and 40F. You definitely want to go up a half size from the chart, especially on a winter shoe where you are likely to wear a thicker sock than traditional thin cycling socks.
review.name: Hey I can feel my toes

review.reviewBody: I’m a Specialized S-Works shoe guy for both on and off road.  They unfortunately do not make a winter shoe and booties are a pain for off-road.  I saw these on sale and decided to try them.  They are nearly perfect.  I’ve found I have to get the Velcro strap just-so in order to prevent ankle rub from the high cuff.  While I’ve continued to perfect how to replicate that just-so Velcro strap placement, I liked these enough to also purchase the road version (which also requires attention with Velcro tightness).  I wear the same size with Fizik as Specialized.   If Fizik improved the cuff even slightly, these would be 5-stars in my book.
review.name: Solid winter shoes

review.itemreviewed: S/Pro Supra Boa 120 GW Ski Boot - 2025 - Men's
review.reviewBody: Only have a few runs on them around Colorado mtns and they fit my feet really well and offer great control at least on groomers since that's the only thing opened right now.  I really like the boa on the top of the foot since it doesn't create any hot spots and applies even pressure overtop and keeps your heals planted
review.name: super comfy boots

review.itemreviewed: S/Pro Supra Boa 120 GW Ski Boot - 2025 - Men's
review.reviewBody: I don’t know what the deal with the rest of these reviews are, but here’s a review from an actual real person from the United States, who skis in the northeast. They are great boots for someone with a low volume foot looking for a tight fit, and good responsiveness. I found these boots to be stiffer than almost every other brand in the 120 range, including Lange and Nordica. I’m not 100% sold on the BOA system, but it seems to work pretty well. My only complaint is that these boots are exceptionally difficult to get on at first. Once they break in, it gets a little easier, but they’re still difficult. However, their performance and fit is fantastic. I’m very happy with my purchase. I would encourage everyone to try it on and see what they think..
review.name: Great boots

review.itemreviewed: S/Pro Supra Boa 120 GW Ski Boot - 2025 - Men's
review.reviewBody: Buying ski boots can be a painful experience, literally. These BOA design boots are the exception. Most comfortable boots I have ever had.
review.name: Comfort Comfort

review.itemreviewed: S/Pro Supra Boa 120 GW Ski Boot - 2025 - Men's
review.reviewBody: The overall product is very solid, with great quality. The BOA system appears to be durable and easy to use. However, getting into the boot feels more challenging compared to the buckled version. The BOA system restricts the boot from opening up as much. The main issue arises from the liner tongue, which has a Velcro construction. If it’s not properly fitted, the rough edge of the removable tongue can cause discomfort in the front part of the foot.
review.name: great product but lacking some attention to detail

review.itemreviewed: S/Pro Supra Boa 120 GW Ski Boot - 2025 - Men's
review.reviewBody: Fantastic quality and fit.  BOA really makes a difference.  Thoroughly recommend
review.name: Best boots ever

review.itemreviewed: S/Pro Supra Boa 120 GW Ski Boot - 2025 - Men's
review.reviewBody: Just heated up the liners put some inserts in and went on a trip. No what I call hot spots feet stayed toasty, great days of skiing and as we all know boots will make or break ski trips.
review.name: Great boot right out of the box

review.reviewBody: I made a wise choice with these boots. They've allowed me to enter and exit boat launches with dry feet - Defintely making my kayaking and canoeing more comfortable
review.name: I made a wise choice with these boots

review.reviewBody:
Wetfoot canoeist? Making shoulder season trips? Looking for confidence and control on portages? These boots are going with me to the Boundary Waters in October. Great features, well designed, feel great. Great contact for walking over rocks. There is no insole in this boot. No half sizes. 

These boots do NOT fit like muck boots or Superior boots. They are not even as roomy as hiking boots. They fit like diving boots or thin-soled sneakers. (I like this style; my summer wetfoot/water shoes are Astral Loyaks). 

For somebody like me with a high volume foot, wide in the forefoot and narrow in the heel, the boots run short and narrow in the forefoot. I had to return the size 7 (my normal boot size) and go up to an 8, just to accomodate a footbed with a lightweight (thin) wool sock. The expert review in Men's Journal recommends light socks with Boundary Boots. I agree. If you're planning on frigid weather, go up two sizes to accomodate heavy wool socks.
review.name: Great Boot: Size up!

review.reviewBody: I needed some muck boots that I could lace up or tighten over my feet. These worked great accept for the leak on one seam that I found on day 2 of our 5 day boundary waters trip. Otherwise they were built well and are comfortable. I?ll update this to 5 stars  if the warranty/exchange works out well. They run a little long and wide.  I?m usually a 15 in Nike tennis shoes but these 14s still had some space for extra layers of wool socks.
review.name: Mostly Great

review.reviewBody: Excellent stove. Puts out a lot of heat!  Pans do not sit stable on the grate because the middle wire is slightly higher than the ones on either side of it. It would be nice if Coleman would refine this issue but its not a dealbreaker.
review.name: Excellent despite room for improvement

review.reviewBody: This is good ,excellent , good price, good quality so far so good, easy to clean,
review.name: Triton stove.

review.reviewBody: so far so good.  done 3 pots of popcorn with not burned 'old maids / grumpy old men" to show for it.  The dog loves it all.  If the west would stop burning up we'd take it on the road and give it a real try.,  would recommend to anyone, friend or otherwise.  great flame control.  Much better than the same stove we bought for our honeymoon in 1985 that we've used CONSTANTLy since and were dorry to have to dispose of udring out last camping trip.  At 77, I don't think I will live long enough to have to worry about this stove wearing out.
review.name: stove runs good

review.reviewBody: Nice unit, works very well. It is easy to set up and tear down. I have only used it once thus far. I like it and look forward to my next trip. A couple would be nice to haves, a marker on the burner knobs, the flames were are hard to see not I was not sure how high/low it was set at. It would also be nice if the unit was able to stand up right when folded up. The flame piece I will get with more use and the standing piece is not a big deal.
review.name: Recommend

review.reviewBody: works perfectly as described. My 40 y/o Coleman is still working but I wanted a new one.
review.name: Triton rocks

review.reviewBody:
The stove works like a charm, and it was very easy to set up.
I had to use a lighter since the ignition button never started the flame and it was very loud.
review.name: Poor ignition button
comment:
Hello!

Thank you very much for your feedback on our Triton™+ 2-Burner Propane Gas Camping Stove! We are very sorry to hear about the issues with the ignition button and we sincerely apologize for the inconvenience! 

We would like to have a chance to assist you further, that is why we strongly encourage you to reach out to us directly via https://www.coleman.com/support/contact-us.

Thank you!

Coleman Consumer Care

review.reviewBody:
After briefly testing this stove here are my impressions.
Cons
- Made from thin metal. One drop may destroy or severely damage.
- Latch does the job but won't take much abuse. Not it doesn't clamp the stove closed it just holds it closed.
- The only way to keep the lid at an upright position is if the wind guards on the side are used.
-:The burner knobs feel like they should only be turned slowly or they will strip out. 
- Repairs if necessary look difficult or impossible.
- Made in China. 

Pros
- Big enough cook area to use most any pans or pots
- Easy and quick to setup 
- Lightweight 
- Nice looking

Conclusion
This isn't your patents Coleman stove (I have a 40 year old liquid gas that still works). This were made in the US and could be repaired. With that said the stove if taken care of and used gently should easily take care of your cooking needs.
review.name: Decent but cheaply made stove.

review.reviewBody: Although I like this camp stove, it does have its problems. The ignition on the left burner doesn't work well. I have to use a lighter on it. Kind of defeats the purpose of spending the extra money for a stove with ignition if I still have to use a lighter.  Other than that it does the trick.  So save your money and get the model without ignition.
review.name: Could be better
comment:
Hello, thank you for leaving the review on our Triton™+ 2-Burner Propane Gas Camping Stove. We're really sorry that it didn't fully meet your expectations on this occasion. If you require further assistance, please reach out to us via our official Coleman "Contact Us" https://www.coleman.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon.-Fri. 9am -5pm Eastern Time.

Thank you and please stay safe!
Coleman Care

review.reviewBody: I'm a convert to LP camp stoves, using Coleman white gas units all my life. My buddy convinced me because he uses his Triton (his 2nd one, he's been using them since they first came out) all the time at his cottage. He even does all his yearly canning on it. So far, I'm very satisfied with mine.
review.name: Excellent stove at a great price.

review.reviewBody: Great value camping stove. It was just the right size for a little campout. The Triton is compact enough to fit in our kitchen box, and easy to carry. The igniters worked perfectly. Boiling a pot of water was quick. It was pretty windy in the evenings and the Triton struggled a little. Getting a good low heat takes some work. For the money, the Triton is tough to beat.
review.name: Excellent value

name: Triton+ Stove

review.itemreviewed: Guides Down Tall Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this jacket.  I have recently had some health issues and this involves circulatory system and have gained so much weight in the past 6mos that I can no longer fit in any of my winter coats.   
This jacket has saved my patooty.   I got the Tall 3XXX which was on clearance after Christmas.   I thought it would be too big and I would have to give it to someone else.  It may be a bit too long as I can't reach the bottom of the pockets without hunching over.  But, it works for me (I am 5ft 7 and 248 pounds).   It is nice looking and incredibly warm.
review.name: Love this coat.

review.itemreviewed: Guides Down Tall Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very lightweight, fits well, generous pockets, nice colors
review.name: Excellent

review.itemreviewed: Guides Down Tall Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Just received my Down Hoody and I absolutely love it. Years ago when I was working at a ski resort I was always a little jealous when others had Marmot gear. I found this coat online searching for tall coats and I remembered Marmot quality so I gave it a shot. I couldn’t be happier with it. It fits perfect which when your 6’6” and 265 lbs clothes rarely do. The quality is what I would have expected. Its thermal range is exactly what I wanted. Warmer than a light coat, but not so hot I can’t ever wear it. If it gets really cold I’m sure it would provide the needed protection when it’s zipped up and the hood is up. 
I like it so much I will look at other Marmot gear!
review.name: Great fitting coat with large thermal range.

review.itemreviewed: Guides Down Tall Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a perfect fit and incredibly warm for how light it is
review.name: Great jacket.

review.itemreviewed: Guides Down Tall Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Marmot, is a real nice, and warm coat... I couldn't have asked for anything better! I bought a size bigger, so I can have room, glad I did! It's definitely a 5 ⭐ coat, highly recommended!!
review.name: The "Go To"...

review.itemreviewed: Guides Down Tall Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Very warm. Long enough. Deep packets inside and outside.
review.name: Recommended

review.itemreviewed: Guides Down Tall Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Well made jacket, functional, keeps the cold out--except for the arms.  Each sleeve has a panel with very little insulation, so you will feel the cold all down your arms even if its in the 30s.  Getting down close to 0 degrees I imagine it would be a lot worse.
review.name: Well made jacket, good with one exception

review.itemreviewed: Guides Down Tall Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I'm 6'5 275lbs.  2xt fits great and super warm.  Time will tell on material durability as shell feels thin but nothing to complain about yet.
review.name: Guide Hoody 2xt

review.itemreviewed: Guides Down Tall Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very nice jacket.   As a big,  tall guy,  it's hard to find a good fit.   This jacket was true to the size chart and fits perfect.   Very light weight and warm.   If it proves to be rugged,  I will be completely satisfied with this purchase.
review.name: Warm,  lightweight,  and fits great!

review.itemreviewed: Guides Down Tall Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very warm and well fitting jacket.  Upon initially wearing this coat, you can see that it is not meant for rough and tough type of wear IMO. The outer shell seems delicate. 
     The hood conforms to your head nicely and has almost like a small visor at the end to protect you from the elements on your forehead, which is awesome
review.name: Blizzard and Cold killer

name: Guides Down Tall Hooded Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: I’ve been wearing SIDI for 45 hear though I did stray once for another brand of MT Bike shoes I quickly saw the error of my ways and purchased a pair of Dragons. These 60s fit great their super light the new micro adjustment is an improvement over previous SIDI versions.
review.name: Still Number One

review.reviewBody:
The Sidi Sixty is definitely a fine bicycling shoe.  It fits well (though one must prepare in advance for Italian sizing: add a size or two) and it functions well on the road.  

The closure system takes some getting use to.  The small lever on the side of the wheel is key.  One needs to keep pressing that while donning and doffing the show.  Also the velcro strap seems to be of limited utility.
review.name: Good Shoes -- interesting closure mechan

review.reviewBody:
These shoes have a great stiff sole to launch a sprint or climb quickly. I wear a 44.5 in all my other sidis- shot, wires and the sizing is the same.

They are lighter than my other sidis yet still retain the quality build.

Highly recommend.
review.name: Awesome shoes!

review.reviewBody:
I expected more from shoes costing $450, these are a real disappointment.

The Sidi proprietary Techno-4 Boa style closure is fiddly and clunky, not user friendly. Newer Boa brand closures turn to tighten and loosen, this one-way-only closure has a spring loaded button to open, a separate small flip-up handle to tighten, and an even smaller red button to release the flip-up handle. Sidi needs to abandon this clunky, dated mechanism.

There's also a Velcro strip on one side of the tongue and upper, designed to keep the tongue from moving, but it's unnecessary and annoying.
review.name: Clunky Techno-4 Boa, Velcro on Tongue
comment:
Hey Timazon,
 
You may want to actually try the shoes on a bike before trashing them and leaving a ridiculous review both here and on Amazon!

review.reviewBody: I love these shoes.The quality is outstanding.I wear size 10 in almost everything and so I bought a size 44.The fit is spot on with plenty of adjustment between the strap and the dials.
review.name: Awesome shoes

review.reviewBody: I have Several pairs of Sidi shoes and always order a 46 so I assumed fit would be the same as my wire2 and Tri shoes by Sidi I found that the Sidi 60 fit much larger than both the previous sidi and the heel slip was unacceptable. I do love the quality of the shoes from the naked carbon sole to the super cool designed upper but the fit has to work  and these did not. I did order a 45.5 and length was fine but had a issue with heel slippage again and having the Boa on top only allows you to tighten so much and my foot doesn't have a lot of Meat on the bone so wouldn't work for me but i hate sending back because still think shoe is awesome. I do have a pair of lake cx402 size 46 and these are 10times more comfortable than the sidi shoes so I am just going to order the cx403s and stick with plain old white and black. For size ref i wear a size 12 in running shoes and always fall between 45.5 and 46.5 depending on which cycling shoe I buy Sidi Usually 46 , Shimano 46.5 , Fizik 45.5, lake 46 .
review.name: Great Quality poor fit !
comment:
Similar Issue here... I am on size 41. 

The shoes get loose, heels do slip, especially the left one, and then I get hot and pinching spot on my left foot since it's slightly smaller than the right one. Carbon sole is awesome but it's also extremely stiff... Overall design and esthetics are nice... very light shoe... I also think that when the shoe is new, it needs a little time for the upper to get formed to your foot shape - Sidi is notorious with this. After a few more long rides, I am hopeful it will get better.
I also experienced heel slip on otherwise correctly sized shoes, and I don't have narrow feet or heels.

name: Sixty Cycling Shoe - Men's

description: Buy the MSR Dynalock Ascent Poles online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Dynalock Ascent Poles
hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR Dynalock Ascent Poles online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: These poles are light but sturdy, pack down small and are easy to set up. Would recommend.
review.name: Would recommend

review.reviewBody: I am a big fan of MSR equipment and was delighted to learn that they now make their own hiking poles. In the last 4-5 weeks I have hiked with those poles in six or seven 10 mile hikes and they are still great. Looking forward to continuing with them for a long time to come.
review.name: A long time to come!!

review.reviewBody: My recently angry spine convinced me to try these poles and I can't wait to get started! I want to practice good technique from the start, though, and how-to videos for beginners straight from the horse's mouth (that's you, MSR) on your website would be good. I'll find some but would rather hear it from you. Also, I agree that those little baskets are impossible to push on until they're flush with the flange. Even my 30-something son gave up.
review.name: Exciting!

review.reviewBody: These poles are great, they set up and break down very easy and are very solid. Any negative reviews are likely someone that doesnt know how to use them, watch the videos…….
review.name: I’m going to order another set

review.reviewBody: I purchased one set for me and used them hiking and was so impressed with the comfort and “swing-ability” that I purchased another set to give my wife for Christmas. We are both on the short side at 5’-4” and 5’ so we purchased the smaller size. Very packable into our airline carry on travel packs. These babies snap open quickly and pack up nearly as fast.
review.name: My third set of poles….and by far the best set

review.reviewBody: Just received these today. They are sadly very over complicated and have far too many ways to break down. I just wanted simple adjustable poles for hiking. I am turning and pushing the baskets with all my strength and can not get them past the section with raised lines. I guess I will be returning these for some simplified poles without all the unnecessary bells and whistles that will just work.
review.name: over complicated

review.reviewBody: These are the best trekking poles I have ever owned. Lightweight , very comfortable, very convenient with the flick-lock to adjust length as opposed to 3 section poles. Definitely recommend purchasing.
review.name: Great Purchase

review.reviewBody:
These are perfect - hardy for a carbon pole so I've used them on plenty of rocky terrain but very lightweight for carrying on a trail run. I find them very comfortable and adjustable for both myself and my wife. The action to pack them away is quick and they pack down to a very small size.

They have been perfect poles for a wide range of activities (snow shoeing, hiking, trail running!) and across such variety of terrain (rocky mountains, boggy meadows, and so much more!).

Fitting them was very easy - they fit true to the size guide on MSR's website and are easy to adjust.
review.name: Perfect poles!

review.reviewBody: Excellent trekking poles. Used them in the Himalayas & found them super light, strong and particularly beneficial for long, steep descents.
review.name: First-rate trekking poles.

review.reviewBody: I hike regularly in the White Mountains of NH and have used several different trekking poles. These are by far my favorites. They are so light! And the ease of set-up and fold-down is fabulous. They feel stable and sturdy when hiking, even though they are so lightweight. Easy to fold up and stash away if desired. Brilliant system! The only difficulty I had was getting the snow baskets on. Very tight. They are on but not sure if I can get them off! But this is minor. These poles are a dream. If you hold them, you'll want them.
review.name: Favorite Poles Ever

name: Dynalock Ascent Poles

review.reviewBody: Factory ran the print upside down. Ordered a pair and the mushrooms were upside down. Ordered the remaining 4 in stock and they were also all upside down (if you want one, it'll be in stock as soon as my return gets through). Should be sold off as seconds, not firsts. Backcountry should have requested a new run instead of accepting incorrectly made product.
review.name: All the mushrooms are upside down

review.reviewBody: I loved the style but literally had the exact problem as Cara H.'s husband, just on the opposite side. Had them less than 4 months, they fit just right and they just ripped right next to the seam on the side.
review.name: Ripped along the side

review.reviewBody: I bought a pair for my husband who loved the mushroom pattern. He has worn them about 6 times since receiving them two months ago. Recently he sat down and the side seam completely ripped open. They fit as they should, so I'm wondering if this is some sort of quality control issue. We are both disappointed because otherwise they seem like great shorts! For the price, I'd hope they would last longer.
review.name: Didn't last very long :(

review.reviewBody: These shorts are awesome, have amazing breathability and if paired with the right underwear can keep you cool on even the hottest of days. With most shorts of this type having built in netting / compression shorts it was nice to find a pair without! also love the snap closures on the back pockets.
review.name: Talk about breathability

review.reviewBody: I've always loved the Castelli climber's jerseys for hot weather riding, and while they keep getting better with every iteration, they all carry the same caveats. First, this is a thin jersey. If you choose to wear it without a base layer just know that it will show everything underneath it. Second, this isn't a problem but know that this jersey is composed of two primary fabrics: a waffle-like fabric for the torso and then a smoother fabric for the arms. Finally, the elephant in the room, that Castelli form-fit sizing. I actually find that the sizing is fairly accurate if you accept that "fit" here means "if it zips it fits". I would read the sizing chart as an upper bound of dimensions that can possibly squeeze into a given size. All in all a great jersey, but if you're looking for a relaxed fit that you can hide in this is probably not the jersey you're looking for.
review.name: "Castelli" form-fit sizes in full effect

name: Climber's 4.0 Limited Edition Jersey - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the PNW Components Rainier IR V3 Dropper Seatpost online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: So I have a LUNA X2 Ludicrous EMTB, & I installed to replace the KS 100mm Remote dropper post but even though the KS is cheaper.  It was way better when it came to not moving at all left or right.  I have a PNW COAST on my Hardtail, & I assumed the movement right & left was due to the integrated 30mm travel suspension.  But now I bought this Rainier 3 170mmTraval. Set to 0 & it does the EXACT same thing.  I don't know how detrimental this is, or if it will cause issues or failures in the future.  But the Cheap 89-dollar KS was solid as a rock.  Tbh in 200 dollar range I'd consider higher end KS models.  I contacted PNW will update if I learn anthing new.
review.name: Not impressed.  It shifts left to right.

review.reviewBody: Functions exactly how it needs to consistently. In use for 2 years, only one minor tuning required. Does get a bit of play in it, but nothing that you'll notice while riding.
review.name: Good dropper post

review.reviewBody: I have been using this dropper for the last 18 months. works great. Need to do service soon though
review.name: great product

review.reviewBody: This is a solid , smooth seatpost. Very little movement.
review.name: Solid

review.reviewBody: I purchased the Gen 3 200mm dropper and love it. Have been using it almost daily for one month. Love the 5mm increment easy adjustability. That alone is reason to purchase. Should be an industry standard.
review.name: Gen 3 is a Win

name: Rainier IR V3 Dropper Seatpost

review.reviewBody:
I have always purchased SAM. and always happy I did. 

SAM. is really consistent, year after year, their XS, S, M is the same, so if your body hasn't changed and you were a M last year, you're going to be a M this season too.

Sizing: they do run small, I'm always an XS or S, and in SAM., as always, I'm a Small. It's narrow in the waist and hits just below hip bone. 

Color: exactly as photo shows, i.e., a real bright glossy cherry red. I

Warmth & Wind Resistance: It's warm, the filling is really dense and the zippers zip and is part of how wind resistant SAM is.

Water:  these SAM.s are - just as they say = very water resistant but not waterproof. when they do get wet, when I get inside I wipe moisture off and let them air dry, I don't wear them in heavy rain and if I get caught in heavy rain I put I get a plastic poncho to put over them. when they have gotten wet and I air dry, the filling isn't impacted, again, the filling is really dense.

Shipping: grateful that BackCountry always packs these in a sturdy box so when I get them - my 2nd SAM/ purchase via BackCountry, it's not crushed. 

p.s.  (I've bought (5) other SAM. puffers over the years at other stores closer to me,  they last as good as new for about 2 years ;-)
review.name: Glossy Warm Wind Resistant High Quality

review.reviewBody: Unlike the other reviewer I had a great experience. I was able to quickly return my items and they sent me a return label. I also spoke with someone directly on the phone to place a new order as the vest was a bit small. The product was in new and unused condition. Very happy with the process and the company. I will be a returning customer! Thank you Backcountry!!
review.name: Great service!

review.reviewBody: I was sent a used and ripped vest. It smelled like someone’s perfume when I took it out of the bag. The return process was painful. My gearhead is never around and it took me an hour worth of chats just to get a refund the thing looks like a garbage bag.
review.name: Used & ripped

name: Freedom Vest - Women's

review.reviewBody:
I've used this jacket a few times now. And I really do love it!
I like that the chest pockets are deep. So if you put something in them, and forget to zip it closed, nothing will fall out too easily.
It has a double zipper ! So rare in rain/snow jackets nowadays.
What I am most happy with; is that the inner liner isn't 'welded' to the outside.
This allows it to move as you do. Without feeling like you are 'stuck' to the inside
of the jacket.
I did have a bit of a problem with the front zipper in that when I try to unzip all the way it sometimes binds...Not a real issue over all.
I am 5'8" and 145#. I got the small based on their size chart. It fits perfectly.
HOWEVER. If I was 5' 10" and 160# .A small would be way too tight.,
review.name: Cottonwood snow jacket

review.reviewBody:
Four stars might be generous, but I like this jacket despite some quirky design choices.  If I had paid full price, I might have returned it, but at 40% off, I don't mind doing some DIY with a scissors.

PRO:
Good hard shell (but not heavy).  Some people might not care for how stiff it is, but I like it.
Comfortable (after removing silly "powder skirt," see below)
More storage/bigger pockets than any other jacket I've ever had (including interior mesh pockets on *both* sides)
Two-way main zipper--an absolute must if your selling long jackets to short skiers
Wrist gaitors--cozy
Beautiful royal blue color

CON:
Strange implementation of powder skirt based on super-tight elastic strap that strangles your stomach.  Resort skiers like me seldom see deep pow, so I went ahead and cut the whole thing out.  Ahhhhh, that's better!

Logos, I can live with, but the huge "Backcountry.com" billboard on the back of the left arm is just an insult.  The off-white lettering is rubberized, but I think it will accept black magic marker to make it at least a little less conspicuous.

Rubber coating on ends of zipper pulls might be functional but looks too much like tassles.  I cut off the ends and replaced them with plain snap-on pulls.  (Even the tiniest cords have "backcountry.com" printed on them.  Sheesh.)

JURY STILL OUT:
The underarm zippered vents are about twice as long as any I've seen before, but the width of the opening is severely restricted by mesh fabric (to keep powder out, of course).  I'll need to gain some more experience before deciding about cutting the mesh out.  The long, oddly-angled zipper requires two separate tugs at different angles (I change hands) to open or close all the way, but I can adapt to that if the cooling is effective.
review.name: Quirky shell that I plan to use, but...

review.reviewBody:
Last season I bought a set of Cottonwods bibs and jacket for my wife. And those were great: 3 layer gore-tex membrane, rugged and tough shell material, full powder skirt, great overall design and colours. 
I liked it more than my topmost TNF Summit series Tsirku set and decided to buy Cottonwods for myself. Unfortunately last season collection was already sold out, so I had to wait for a new one.
I didn't expect any improvements. Last year models were already almost a masterpiece. But what I really didn't expect that a great product will be ruined.
- Rugged material is replaced with a thin and soft recycled cloth
- Poor quality zippers which do not match every second time you wan't to close them, making impossible to zip up the jacket. I bet those won't last a year.
- Interior pocket is replaced with a piece of mesh
- 1/3 of powder skirt is replaced with a rubber band
- No windproof pad under the zipper
- Convertible half-drop hood instead of integrated one
- Overall bad design and weird colours. Huge logo on the sleeve.
review.name: Does not live up to expectations

review.reviewBody: I love smith and It’s exactly why I’m taking the time to write my first review ever because these things are that bad. I was SO excited to get these, was on the pre order list for months and got them as soon as they became available. And since then, they have been nothing but terrible honestly for a lens that’s supposed to be meant for physical activity. Horrible they never stay in the frame as they properly should and now any time I flip them up or down the whole lenses pops out. The concept and design is awesome but whoever let this leave the cool idea board is a silly little goose. Once again I like Smith they make good products but definitely pooped the bed with this one.
review.name: DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY

review.reviewBody: Hinge broke after a few months of use and smiths warranty department said they would not cover it. Really short lifespan for a seemingly great product.
review.name: Broke after a few months

review.reviewBody: Absolutely loved the style of these. But as other reviews have mentioned they scratch very easy and the lenses easily pop off the nose bridge. Very annoying. Thankful the Smith service team was very quick with a warranty resolution.
review.name: Great style, poor quality

review.reviewBody: they look cool and function cool. i have a ton of smith stuff and never have i had any of it scratch so easy.maybe wear them playing gold but any kind of normal active stuff be super cautious with them.
review.name: scrap super easy and no replacement lense.

review.reviewBody: Look/feel good but lenses easily scratch and pop out from locked position constantly requiring adjustment.
review.name: Look/feel good, quality issues

review.reviewBody: Just received these in the mail and love them. Very cool and perfect for skiing in winter and the beach in summer. My fave shades!
review.name: Love them!

review.reviewBody: Used these to upgrade the brakes on an older hard tail, makes going from center lock to 6 bolt rotors easy!
review.name: Great problem solvers

review.reviewBody:
I bought this to convert my Shimano XT centerlock hubs and make them 6-bolt compatible since I already had 6-bolt rotors.

This product is extremely easy to install, and they stay secure. It doesn't seem to significantly affect rotor location as I didn't have to adjust my caliper very much after installation.

I used with standard, one-piece rotors without issue. As mentioned below, this will not likely work with two-piece rotors.

The price is hard to beat, and shipping was quick. Thanks Backcountry!
review.name: An elegant solution for one-piece rotors

review.reviewBody: LOVE the tread and construction, but both sizes I ordered (larger than my norm as per the other reviews) were too slim. Never work with thick socks, hard to get on with thin socks. I want to love these, please, please make a wide width option. I've never ordered wide before,but absolutely would for this adorable boot.
review.name: Need a wide width option, strange fit

review.reviewBody: I truly wanted to LOVE these boots. But, based on other reviews, I bought a size bigger than I normally wear. They were just too uncomfortable from the moment I put them on. So I returned them. But they were beautiful and well made.
review.name: Poor fit for me

review.reviewBody: I love the product. For me, they ran small. I recommend a size up.
review.name: Great! Run small

review.reviewBody: These snow boots are well made and sturdy. Very good quality. I like the zipper feature as I don't like to take time to lace my snow boots. I like the quilted top. Snow pants fit over the boots nicely. Alas, the sizing is off. The toe box is very narrow. I have an average weight foot and generally wear medium width (average) shoes and boots comfortably with mid weight socks. I purchased size 9.5 in this boot which is my regular size for boots. Not only was the toe box much too narrow, but my toes were pushed against the toe of the boot.
review.name: Toe box too narrow and not comparable to size 9.5 in length

review.reviewBody: I love the look of these boots - classic yet stylish. I normally take a size 7, but had to exchange them for a size 8 as they were too tight. The larger size is perfect. They are comfortable and easy to slip on and off. This boot will be warm for winter wear.
review.name: Comfortable stylish boot

review.reviewBody: I wear size 6 1/2 but was advised to go up a half size since my feet are wide. They were too tight so I got size 7 1/2 and they feel much better but I am breaking them in before a winter trip to Japan where we will be doing a lot of walking. The boots are a simple style which I love and will keep my feet warm. I looked at many other winter boots on several websites and none can compare to the Cedar Quilt and I love the color green so this was perfect. I will attach two photos to the review. The photos are not edited and the one true to color is the one showing the side and bottom of the boot.
review.name: Simple style that looks good

review.reviewBody: Love the functional tread with cute quilted pattern. Be mindful that heel may be a bit tight with heavy winter socks. I did not need to break these in. Wore for several hours the first time without any soreness.
review.name: Wonderful boots!

review.reviewBody: The colorway is true to the imagery online. The boot is relatively lightweight for a winter boot and very stylish. The fit itself is quite narrow. I wear an 8 across the board in all brands and very rarely have to size up or down. I needed to size up to a 9 for these boots. They were difficult to get on in my regular size. I'd suggest sizing up.
review.name: Stylish Winter Boot

name: Cedar Quilt Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love Pacsafe, I have 3 other products that I’m happy with and thought I would give this one a try. I bought it specifically for a trip to Europe because -pickpockets- and it started falling apart at the airport before my first flight out of the country. By the second flight the top zipper literally fell on my hand, I couldn’t use it as a backpack because the seam kept coming apart, I was only able to use it on top of my carry on roller and I was able to use the side handle to move it around (an unnecessary annoyance since I’m paying for an expensive product) needles to say this backpack was anything but safe. I contacted customer service right away and they started the return process. The last thing I wanted to do on my vacation was to go shopping for a carry on backpack and yet that’s what I had to do to keep my stuff safe.  STAY AWAY!!!
review.name: STAY AWAY FROM THIS ONE!!

name: Go Carry-On Backpack 34L

review.name: Good steel; still not as good as pizza oven

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Works real good and fast. Taste of the pizza is realy nice!
review.name: Super!! Works real good and fast!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very heavy but very good. This has really helped crisp up our pizza bases and also works well in the kitchen oven too.
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Did not like every pizza burned before top was cooked, will never use again
review.name: Pizza steel

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Weather means the outdoor pizza oven isnt used every time we have pizza. Saw this on offer so bought. Its heavy but fits the oven well. Its taken shop bought ready made and cooked them beautifully. We have made our own (ready made dough) and been impressed with the results - not the colouring of the outside one but cooked well. I prefer it to a pizza stone in the oven. It does take ages to cool down so often forget its in the oven next time I use it! Worth it when on offer.
review.name: Crispy base in the oven

review.reviewBody: Recently purchased this oven steel and found it to be fantastic. It cooks the pizza just like in the outside oven . It cooks it quickly, about 4-5 minutes and produces the same crust as if cooked outside. Would highly recommend.
review.name: Brilliant

review.reviewBody: Far better than a pizza stone in the oven, pizza cook qicker and better, don't know why i didn't get one earlier
review.name: Pizza Steel

review.reviewBody:
Bought this for when it’s cold or raining . I have a Ooni gray and Ooni Karu 12g and pride myself on producing excellent pizza . It takes. 6 minutes to cook a pizza and does a reasonable job but not a match for a real pizza oven . I find it makes the base too crispy but I am a bit of a connoisseur when it comes to pizzas . If you haven’t got an Ooni oven then I
Expect your be happy but if a you already have I think you’d be disappointed. Also really hard to clean .
review.name: It’s ok but don’t expect anywhere as good as proper Ooni

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Recommended!!
review.name: Excellent product

review.reviewBody: I like the jacket; however, it pumps out at the bottom for a pear shaped body and the medium has more room like a large. The jacket is comfortable and warm and the sleeve insert helps to compensate for long arms. Please consider those who have long arms, though. Finding a jacket that fully covers the arms is difficult. Thankful that the zipper is normal and zips straight up like a zipper should, unlike other brands that have sideways zippers that eat your face when wearing it.
review.name: Warm and comfortable but think about your body shape

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I had one of these jackets for 11 years. I wore it working at the dog sled races, skiing, cutting wood for our wood burner. The zipper wore out, got burn holes from a fire on out lake so I bought another one. Just got it and some new features are great! Plus I could get a tall!
review.name: Winter coat for the UP of Michigan!

It’s hard to find a jacket that buttons inside and that is my favorite feature. I’m not a snowboarder or skier. I’m using it for winter, and I love it. It’s fits nicely where I can still have a sweater underneath and it not feel too snug.
review.name: Great for city life

review.reviewBody:
My rack consists of Black Diamond and Wild Country.  When the time came to get a second Back Diamond size #4, I decided to give a DMM Dragon #6 (same as the BD #4 size) a try, mainly because these are much cheaper than both BD & WC cams.  I figured at half the price, what's the real downside as a second cam?

Well, I can tell you these are not fun to place or clean, at least compared to BD cams of which I have years of experience climbing on.  I don't like the small finger pad used as opposing pressure when pulling the trigger and these are much more "floppy" than BDs, making them really hard to place precisely, and bumping these is even more challenging.

My follower complained too about removing them for basically the same reasons.  Another climbing partner lead a pitch with it and also complained and she said she'd stick with BD.

And why they can't keep the size numbering roughly the same as other manufactures is pretty annoying too.  Because after all, all the beta I've come across is using BD sizing.

There are some things to like about this cam:  The lobe profile is indeed unique and feels great once you finally get it placed.  And I like extending slings on cams too.  But when you're pumped hanging on a jam struggling to place an uncooperative cam, it quickly becomes evident what matters.

Perhaps the smaller cams don't have these issues since the heads will be lighter and maybe easier to control.  I won't be taking a chance with any more Dragon cams to find out.
review.name: I Don't Like

review.reviewBody:
I wanted to add to Alyssa’s review. I agree loves are bomber on these. I have had a much better experience than she has suggested. Here is why. 

Sling length. Total length lobe to end of sling (see excellent reference pic from Alyssa) is actually quite a bit longer than the BD but not much longer than the WC. This is nice. I feel that the biggest benefit is the length of the sling itself (with short stem). Put all of these cams in a crack and move the carabiner around and up and down and you’ll see the DMM is lest likely to walk because the sling is a buffer from the climbers movements. 

On a lot of climbs, the extended sling is all I need. On others, I still need an alpine draw. I don’t think any cam will ever be able to compensate for wandering routes, but those with slight deviations are handled quite nicely! 

Finger shredding/retrieval. In the nice picture A shared, you can see the that the distance from lobes to trigger is almost identical across the 3 brands shown. So, if these were all in I’d tical placements, the trigger would be the same depth across the 3 the trigger is no harder to reach. HoWEVER, the short stem (praised for its stability in my first paragraph) can lead to making it a little harder to retrieve because to squeeze the trigger your palm or thumb have to push the stem. With the other two brands, you can sometimes use the outside of the thumb loop to get your leverage (thus keeping your hand a little more stretched out…?) 

Anyway I quite like these cams. And if you really want the absolute best, go get some DMM offset nuts. Don’t look at anything else. Buy them, try them, love them.
review.name: Very nice!

review.reviewBody:
I have the red Dragon and I love almost everything about it. When it is placed, I feel super good about it. The lobes are SO nice I have no worries about it walking or sliding around. God they?re so perfect and sticky. Makes me drool. (See photo of lobe comparison between WC friends, DMM dragons, and BD C4s).

My issue with these comes more as a follower. They?°re hard to clean. The stem is small and the trigger can be hard to reach before you scrape up your fingers trying to retract it. I was out yesterday with a friend who has a whole double rack of DMM Dragons, and I was missing my Wild Country Friends and BD C4s. Even my Metolius cams. They?re just easier to clean, to be honest.

My other issue is the extendable slings. What I thought was a main selling point ended up being an annoyance. You can only extend it from one side, or it?°°ll get caught and not extend all the way. The sewn part of the sling just will not pass through the stem. So when I?m pumped and trying to extend the sling, I have to fiddle with it for longer than it would take to just put in a separate sling. Also, retracting the sling as a follower is annoying. I am posting a photo of the length of the DMM sling as compared to the BD C4s and the Wild Country Friends. In my opinion, if you need to extend the placement, 3 inches doesn’t substitute the need for a QuickDraw or 60cm sling. You?ll often find yourself still needing a sling even after extending it.

All in all, I think these have their place. If you are climbing splitter sandstone cracks or slippery limestone, these would be a great choice. The machined lobes are literally to die for and unlike any other cam I have used. But the stem length and extendable sling becomes a turn off, especially if you mainly climb on granite (like I do).
review.name: Great lobes, but the rest needs work

name: Dragon 2 Cam

review.itemreviewed: ThermoBall Eco Hooded Insulated Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Cute coat and looks nice on. It does run a little small. I normally wear a small but based on other reviews purchased the medium and I'm glad I did to allow room for thicker clothing on underneath. The medium fits me fine. It is lightweight and pretty thin, I haven't gotten to try it out in the cold yet. I'm not sure if it's worth the money honestly.
review.name: Nice coat

review.itemreviewed: ThermoBall Eco Hooded Insulated Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: While it's incredibly warm and comfortable, the neck area is too loose to offer a snug fit. This makes my neck feel exposed, unless I'm wearing a neck cover. It's a bit inconvenient, especially in cold weather, as the loose neck doesn't help trap the warmth as I expected , particularly since my neck is sensitive to the cold.The jacket is otherwise well-crafted and cozy, but I would recommend improving the neck fit for a more secure and warm experience.
review.name: Warm Jacket, But the Loose Neck Let's the Cold In

review.itemreviewed: ThermoBall Eco Hooded Insulated Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: The jacket itself is great, keeps you warm, but the zip can sometimes be tricky. It's quite thin & small. So not always super easy to just pull up. Also the stitches along both arms prick at points. So, not a 100% smooth feel.
review.name: Good buy for winter

review.itemreviewed: ThermoBall Eco Hooded Insulated Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have 2 of this jacket one in size L but gained weight so bought one in XL. Usually don't need a hood but some days I do, don't want to drag a hat out shopping. It is a flattering style.
review.name: I did buy a second jacket, love it.

review.reviewBody: Stretch and confortable…what could you want more? Style? Yes they got it!
review.name: Perfect short!

review.reviewBody: These shorts are light in material, strong in support and functional in movement. The bonus of having 2 pockets in front and 1 in the back make these shorts a personal favorite! Love these shorts, own 2 pair!
review.name: comfort and function

review.reviewBody: Super lightweight, slightly longer inseam than expected but they’re awesome.
review.name: Comfy

review.reviewBody: I wear them all day everyday for every activity. I need another pair.
review.name: Can’t stop wearing them

review.reviewBody: These things are near weightless. The shorts are comfortable and move well.
review.name: Ultra light weight shorts

review.reviewBody: The waistband is perfect for wearing under a backpack hip-belt. These are super light and my go-to shorts for summer backpacking
review.name: Light and comfy

review.reviewBody:
My go to shorts for climbing and even hiking. 

The synthetic mater is very light and airy. Dry out really fast. 

The elastic waste is great, eliminating the need for a belt and extra bulk under a harness or what now.
review.name: Light and airy

review.reviewBody: I was leery about shorts with no belt loops as I thought they would gradually fall off while hiking, but these short stay put. They breath really well and are so light that you barely notice them. If you get rained on, they dry incredibly fast. The pockets are big enough to safely carry a phone, and even with the extra weight they stay up. I don't expect them to be the most durable, but the comfort makes up for that. I loved my first pair and ended up buying two more pairs and they are now my go-to shorts for hiking and backpacking.
review.name: Perfect backpacking shorts

review.reviewBody: Feels great while climbing, lightweight and feels like i am wearing underwear. Could use a drawstring or an ability to tighten because things in pockets pull down when jumping and climbing a bit if they are heavier like phones or rolls of quarters.
review.name: Verry nica pantas

review.reviewBody: I have worn these in Utah, Arizona, and Virginia for various climbing, hiking, and camping. These shorts are great for climbing and all types of working out - indoors or outdoors. I've worn them during tons of other daily activities when I find the pockets are not great for keeping things in. I can't tell you how many times my phone and wallet have fallen out of the pockets when sitting. Use them for what they are meant for and not to be your daily drivers. I love how light and quick drying they are. Perfect for all the activities we love BD gear for.
review.name: Good for climbing or workout

name: Sierra LT Short - Men's

review.reviewBody: These skies look and feel great. True to size and I actually use them because they're so easy to put on and I can even adjust them while riding. They feel high quality and should last a long time. Good balance between walking comfort and stiffness.
review.name: Love the boa laces!

review.reviewBody: I use these shoes for spinning in the gym. they are comfortable and easy to adjust. Looks great.
review.name: comfortable shoes

review.reviewBody:
I ordered two pairs of these shoes in sizes 47 and 48.  I found them to fit true to size (NW had a nice size chart on their site).  The 47 was the suggested size and it fit well though a touch more length might be nice.

The shoe is well made and very comfortable.  The overall quality is on par with most big brands IMO.   

These are not for the racers or anyone who wants a stiff performance shoe.  These are for more casual riding or Ebikes.  

I ended up returning them because I felt they would be too flexible for a person my size (260lbs) when mountain biking where much of the time is spent out of the saddle.  I would be happy to use them for road, gravel, path, and commuter rides where you spend the majority of your time in the saddle.  They would probably work well enough on short MTB rides.  

I also tried the NW Rocket Plus and NW X-Trail Plus shoes.  I found those to be a little more suitable for someone my size.  I'll leave a review for those on here as well.
review.name: Comfortable and (too) flexible!

name: Corsair Mountain Bike Shoe - Men's

hasVariant.name: Triton Stove

review.reviewBody: This stove was built extremely well, very solid, and a breeze to set up! In less than 5 minutes, it was up and running and the burners boiled the water in my tea kettle just as fast as my camper stove, if not faster. I appreciate that the stove has minimal parts which makes cleaning easy. You can make full meals with this little thing. I am a very big fan and I highly recommend this.
review.name: This is a fantastic stove!

review.reviewBody: This is a great stove!  It's really sturdy and works great for our camping needs!
review.name: Awesome stove!

review.reviewBody: Serious (and very unsafe!) manufacturing defects.  Both burners were permanently affixed in a skewed way, and the flat plate was off-center leading to a gap along one edge.
review.name: unsafe manufacturing defects
comment:
Hello!

Thank you very much for your feedback on our Triton™ 2-Burner Propane Camping Stove! We are very sorry to hear about the defects and we sincerely apologize for the inconvenience caused! It definitely should not have happened!

We would like to have a chance to assist you further, that is why we strongly encourage you to reach out to us directly via our official "Contact Us" page.

Thank you!

Coleman Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: This stove is poorly built junk. If you buy it thinking that you’ll get a quality Coleman stove that lasts for 20+ years you are solely mistaken. This appears to have been made to improve Coleman’s finances not yours.
review.name: DO NOT BUY. This stove is poorly built junk
comment:
Hello!

We apologize if your experience with our product was unsatisfactory. By consistently improving our services and products, we fervently strive for customer satisfaction. As we are looking for ways to improve our product and service, we always ensure that consumers' feedback and concerns are shared.

For further questions or inquiries, you may also visit our contact us web form. On the Coleman website, select "contact us" from the drop-down menu after clicking the question mark logo in the top right corner, which will direct you to our contact web form.

review.reviewBody: This is not only a great compact portable camp stove but it also is a perfect item for tailgating
review.name: Compact Versatility

review.reviewBody: Great unit my second one the old one , older than i
review.name: Working great hopefully as long as the other one

review.reviewBody: Durable, easy to set up, easy to use. The flames are even an consistent.
review.name: Classic camp stove, good quality.

review.reviewBody: Great Stove.   A must for car camping.  Plenty of heat and strong grates. Classic Coleman Stove.
review.name: Car Camping Stove

review.reviewBody: I was happy with this for a number of years. However, the copper gas tube cracked adjacent to the left burner, leaking gas into the interior - which would eventually ignite, or just drain the propane bottle, if lucky. Unbeknownst to me, the tubular bolt behind the left knob that secured the gas valve was loose or loosened. My assessment: the copper tube was acting as the knob rotation stop, flexing slightly each time the knob was turned to full on and full off. This work-hardened the copper and caused it to eventually crack and leak gas.
review.name: Gas leak long-term risk.

review.reviewBody: bought this a few years ago to replace my old green Coleman that lasted more than 25 years because they had discontinued that model. Right away, I found that the design for lighting and ease of use were inferior. Five years later, the copper tube developed a leak where it was welded to the hookup, and became unusable and potentially dangerous as propane would build up inside the stove and ignite from the burner, causing a small explosion that would blow out the burner flame as well. I had to abandon my camping trip a few days early because I was scared to use the stove. It appears that the green stoves are again for sale as the Classic. I'd spend the extra money for that.
review.name: unsafe junk

name: Triton Stove

review.reviewBody: This little guy came to the rescue when my sons pedal fell off on day 1 of the White Rim Trail. Usually pedals require a massive wrench but with the small Allen key slot on the inside of the pedal and the fabulous Topeak Ratchet Rocket Lite DX we were able to put his pedal back on and finish the 3 day biking trip. Topeak is high quality and the Ratchet Rocket Lite is no exception. This will always come with me on future biking trips.
review.name: Saved us on the White Rim Trail

review.reviewBody: I love the shorter xtra tuff! Narrow. Had to size up and still a bit tight. Wear them around town, but won’t be doing any hikes in these like I did my others. Way too tight for that. Wish they were all sized the same! I love the fit of the regular brown ones.
review.name: Narrow but cute!

review.reviewBody: Great boots. Comfortable, good width, sturdy and easy to put on.  Walking the beach and in rain has never been easier
review.name: Will buy again!

review.reviewBody: I had my first pair of darn tough boots for 6 years! Can’t wait to let it rip in these for many seasons to come
review.name: Hardworking Boots
comment: Great to hear you are satisfied with your purchase! Thanks for the support!

review.reviewBody: Love the fit look and feel. The wife loves them. Great for fishing too.
review.name: Best boots

review.reviewBody: These boots are great! They could be a little wider so I may purchase the men's boots next time, but they are awesome for the work that I need to do on our small farm! They are heavy duty and easy to slip on and off as I come and go to do the farm chores. Hopefully they will last longer than my last pair that are not this brand!
review.name: Great Farm Chore Boots

review.reviewBody: seem tight for size 8 and just not the quality I expected for the price
review.name: Not the quality of the price point
comment:
Hello,
Sorry to hear these boots fit tighter than expected. If you would like an exchange, please call Customer Service at 1-866-442-4908.  We want you to be 100% satisfied with your purchase!

review.reviewBody: I’m in love with these boots! I can’t wait for it to rain so I can break them in. I did have to order a 9, the 8 was too tight. I normally wear an 8 or 8 1/2 so I’d say these run a bit small.
review.name: My first pair of xtratufs!!!

review.reviewBody: Awesome fabulous boot!!  F  is still just right, waterproof and stylish.
review.name: Very Fancy!

review.reviewBody: The wife is super happy with her new 12" legacy boots from Xtratuf!!! They fit well and a super comfortable. If you live where it is wet and cool, buy the wife or daughter a pair.
review.name: Xtratuf 12" Legacy boots

review.reviewBody: Definitely waterproof and warm. They did leech a lot of oil when they were brand new.  I researched and realized that's part of a new boot.  The oil dried and now the finish is a bit dull, but function wise they're great.
review.name: Great Functionality
comment: Hello and thank you for providing us with your review. We are happy to hear you are overall satisfied with the boots you purchased. We recommend using a silicon spray/rub to help protect your boots, as long as it is petroleum free.

name: Legacy 12in Boot - Women's

Buy the Thule Subterra 30L Backpack online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Subterra 30L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Subterra 30L Backpack online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Perfect size for my carry on. Well constructed, looks so simple yet elegant.
review.name: Excellent Product

review.reviewBody: I’ve been looking for a new bag to hold all of my daily stuff- laptop, iPad Pro, books/notebooks…and there is still extra space! This bag has been perfect for me!
review.name: Awesome bag!

review.reviewBody: I have yet to put this bag in service but it is feature rich and as I am prepping for a journey it so far all fits that was planned for it. The quality of the bag leaves me no doubt that it will serve me well and last the many miles I have planned for it.
review.name: Getting packed...

review.reviewBody: This backpack has been everywhere with me over the last 2 years. I was blown away by the design- tapers slightly when filling to slip under an airplane seat (not sure if that's an accident or intended but my jaw dropped when I made this connection). Easy laptop and water bottle access, even the 16" and 32oz biggos I carry. Plenty of compartments inside suiting a variety of trip types. What's really incredible about this bag is the durability. Over 100k miles over two years of corporate travel. Still looks brand new, clips are still on, straps still hold. A great travel companion!
review.name: Very Thoughtful and Durable Design

review.reviewBody: i love it! It's a great size for a girl like me (5"2 / 110 pounds). It's beautiful and functional. Has lots of pockets and it's easy to find stuff. I have the carry-on in the same model, they match and l like the minimalist look. I got some compliments.
review.name: Great for small women

review.reviewBody: I have been looking for a backpack that is good for motorcycle commuting and work place packing. I have bought many different types of backpack and never keep them for more than six months. For Thule Subterra, i fell in love with it right away after I open the package. The material is thick and make you like you are having heavy duty while it is light. Organized pockets are well done. It is also easy to take out laptop when you need it.  when I am riding motorcycle, the backpack is steady and attached to my back.
review.name: The right one finally

review.reviewBody: I've been using this bag for a couple months now. Recently went back to school, and I'm usually a busy person that has school, work and also goes to the gym. This bag holds everything I need for the day. The compartments makes it a lot easier to organize my stuff specially tech. Laptop sleeve that you can open up from the side makes it so convenient to quickly access my laptop
review.name: Well Built Tech/Travel/Everyday pack

review.reviewBody: I like the all the space and the pockets. The color is great.
review.name: Nice Design

review.reviewBody: Love it. It looks and feels a bigger than the 23L but doesn't feel that bulky once I put it on. I had bought the 23L first and then exchanged it for this 30L Mineral version, which turned out to be a good decision. I really like this backpack and can't wait to test it out during my upcoming travel.
review.name: Exchanged the 23L for this 30L

review.reviewBody: Just what we were looking for our college student and to be used for anything! Sturdy and great holder for computer,
review.name: Excellent back back well made

name: Subterra 30L Backpack
