review.reviewBody: I am obsessed. It's so cute, girly and super cozy. Perfect for casual wear.
review.name: Beautiful jacket

review.reviewBody: We had some freezing weather here earlier this week—and this jacket kept me wonderfully warm.
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: If you don’t own this fleece you need to change that! It’s so soft and comfy, feels like you’re wrapped in a cloud! I absolutely love skiing in just bibs with a cute layer underneath and this is the best mid layer I’ve ever found! Also, pockets are a must for me and these have deep and functional pockets! And I love having the chest pocket to put my ski pass in! Whether I’m skiing, camping, traveling, etc this is a must have essential!
review.name: My Go To Midlayer

review.reviewBody: Definitely recommend. Got lots of compliments. It fits great and is so cozy.
review.name: Super cute and comfy and at a good price

review.reviewBody: I love the color combination on this jacket! It's lightweight but insulated enough to keep you warm on a chilly and/or windy day. The quality is great and that's why I keep coming back to Cotopaxi! It's a little on the bigger size- not that I'm complaining. It'll fit perfect if you layer under for colder days.

review.reviewBody: My son loves his Capa jacket. He was very happy with the colors and wears it all the time. . . even in the house! Great product!
review.name: Love the Capa Kids Jacket

review.reviewBody: Ordered a size XL, fits a woman 5’2” 140lbs normally a S/M. Little snugger at hips than I would prefer, but still fits well.
review.name: Great style and fit!

review.reviewBody: Our whole family bought Cotopaxi jackets this fall based on a friend’s recommendation of how warm and lightweight they were and how easy to pack. I LOVE that we have warm jackets that are easy to travel with!
review.name: Will Definitely Buy Again

review.reviewBody: My daughter loves this jacket and that it is reversible! I recommend it!
review.name: Looks sharp and fits great!

review.reviewBody: The first time I wore the jacket it was really windy and I was still warm
review.name: The first time I wore

review.reviewBody: This is the perfect jacket for our Georgia fall weather. My son loves it.
review.name: Awesome coat!

review.reviewBody: This jacket is lightweight but warm. My daughter loves the colors and flexibility it has for cross country skiing. Looks great on both sides!
review.name: Great jacket!

description: Buy the Klymit Static V2 Sleeping Pad online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Static V2 Sleeping Pad
hasVariant.description: Buy the Klymit Static V2 Sleeping Pad online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Great size, great weight, super easy. Can’t wait to use it more.
review.name: Great!

review.reviewBody: Customer service has been great, the quality of the pad is as good as many other products that are much more expensive.

I bought this pad to use in a desert parking lot because i was too afraid of puncturing a good pad. This did its job, was comfortable  enough to sleep on. it is on the narrow side and i wish i bought a wider pad. I found this hard to inflate without a pump sack. Ok for occasional use but would not recommend it as a primary pad.
review.name: Not the easiest to inflate
comment: We are sorry to hear that you are not fully satisfied. Your feedback is important to us, and we'd like to address your concerns. Please contact us at support@klymit.com or 1-888-655-3632 so we can work on improving your experience. Your satisfaction is our top priority.

review.reviewBody: The sleeping pads are lightweight and great for summer camping or short backpacking trips. They are most comfortable for back or stomach sleepers. My two teenage scouts and I have been using this for about three months and they find the pads to be super comfortable. I am a side sleeper and I while using this pad I have been waking up frequently at night because my shoulders keep falling asleep. I do like that the waffle type design helps to keep us cool on summer nights. Overall, I enjoy the light weight and packability of the pad.

Great pad if you’re looking for something compact and affordable. Comfort is good considering its size. Easy to inflate as well. It only took a few seconds using the Klymit usb rechargeable portable pump. If you’re looking for max comfort and size is not an issue then I do recommend getting something larger and thicker. If you’re an ultra lighter looking for something to get you off the ground this is perfect.
review.name: Graf ultralight sleeping pad

review.reviewBody: This pad is just thick enough if you’re a side sleeper, but also packs down small and weighs next to nothing. I highly recommend to the casual backpacker
review.name: Incredible for the price

review.reviewBody: Lightweight, holds air well, valve works well. The pouch it comes in is a tight fit and ripped after a couple uses.

This was purchased with the cover for it. This is being used as a sleeping bag replacement. The air valve is a little tough to get the cover back onto it, but nothing to take points away from. The design of the baffles causes you to "Rock" more when you shift your weight left or right. I found that if I slightly deflated the pad, this effect was dampened.

This sleeping pad is amazing! It's super lightweight, packs down small, and is surprisingly comfortable. The V-shaped design provides great support, so I slept soundly all night. It inflates quickly and is easy to deflate and pack up. Perfect for backpacking or camping, this pad is a total game-changer!
review.name: Best sleeping pad!

review.reviewBody: 9.0/10 this is the best pad ever. I’ve used this item on gravel, dirt, bare floor it’s so comfortable.
review.name: Best Pad I’ve Ever Had

name: Static V2 Sleeping Pad
Static V2 Sleeping Pad

review.itemreviewed: Trailwear QTM Mock Neck Long-Sleeve Shirt - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this cropped trailwear shirt! It's adorable, just the right length for my arms and waist. It feels so sporty and the fabric is awesome... However, it is definitely not my first, or lets be honest, last choice for ACTUAL activities. The seams running the length of the arms make wearing this top in the heat and on longer hikes or bike rides almost unbearable. The seams are not flat and are so irritating when hot and sweaty. I actually have a sore spot in the crook of my elbow from the rubbing... I would buy this again, it's adorable and I feel so pretty wearing it. In my opinion, this top is perfect if you are wanting to LOOK super cute and sporty... But it's NOT functional.

description: Buy the MSR Ceramic Camping Skillet online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Ceramic Camping Skillet
hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR Ceramic Camping Skillet online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Hello, the skillet works as advertised. 
However, I found it to be a little small and shallow for things like boiling water and cooking pasta. I am also unsure how the red plastic switch on the handle and the bar onto which it clips will hold up long term. I just finished using it on a multi-day canoe trip in northern Québec.
review.name: Ceramic Skillet Review

review.reviewBody: As much as I love a good dehydrated meal on the trail, I recently decided I wanted the ability to cook up some proper food so I went on the hunt for a lightweight skillet, and the MSR ceramic skillet absolutely delivered. I was a bit worried about some of the reviews saying the pan would warp or the ceramic coating would burn off, especially since I'm using it with my small pocket rocket 2 stove, however this wasn't the case at all. Just don't assume you can crank the heat to hi and leave the skillet in one place, as long as you are active while cooking and move the skillet around so the heat disperses a bit more evenly and you modulate the gas, you'll be cooking up 5 star meals in the backcountry. Just got back from a multi day thru hike and cooked up steak and potatoes for dinner one night, and bacon and eggs the next morning, what a moral boost while on the trail when you have 10+ miles to go that day. I paired the skillet with the alpine plate(which is also the perfect size to use as a lid for the skillet), the universal canister stand for extra stability(I'd say this is crucial if you're using a 4oz fuel canister, I'd almost definitely knock the stove/skillet over without it), and the alpine spatula just for the sake of convenience and saving the ceramic coating. All in all very happy with the purchase and I look forward to cooking many more meals in the backcountry!
review.name: Perfect addition to any backpacking kit

review.reviewBody: Great product for cooking meat and veggies in the wild. While hunting light packable food is done great with water but when success comes cooking meat in the skillet hits the spot.
review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody: Same high quality I have come to trust with Cascade Design Gear. Bought my first piece of Cascade Design gear in 1980.
review.name: Same high quality I have

review.reviewBody: I have both the Ceramic Skillet and the Ceramic 2 Pot Set, both are great gears, but they do not fit each other.... the Skillet is around 1 inch bigger than the Pot, make it fail to nest together for easy package......
review.name: Good pan, Good Usage, but doesn't fit 2.5L Pot

review.reviewBody: Finally got to field test this skillet at Lost Maples SNA, TX. Nested well with my 2.5L ceramic pot. Cooked a steak for dinner and bacon & eggs for breakfast. Now, I can mix it up with dehydrated and fresh foods. Please make a lid so I can keep the skillet warm.
review.name: Worth the wait. Get on the list!

review.reviewBody: I've used this pan extensively over the last 5 years cooking usually in groups of 3.  It has held up very well.  There is minor bowing in the center which I'm sure would be better if I was using a flame source bigger than a Pocket Rocket.  It is light, cleans very easily and fits perfectly over the top of my BV cans.  While packing I put the bear can screw lid in my pack open-end up, then a towel, then the bear can then the pan.  This way I can access my food without messing with the screw lid.  The Talon handle is fully separable from the pan and re-engages great, never given me any worries.  There should be a picture showing this, because it makes packing this pan super easy.  I'd buy again, it's a no-brainer.
review.name: Excellent workhorse for small groups

review.reviewBody: You never think you need a pan until you have one, great addition to the gear list.
review.name: You want this pan.

review.reviewBody: I purchased this skillet due to the low weight and ceramic coating. I had high hopes that it would be the ultimate backcountry fry pan for cooking anything. I was quite disappointed when my eggs, hash browns, meats, veggies, and other soft foods quickly began sticking/burning near the center of the stove. This original spot now regularly burns food and the bottom of the pan has warped slightly outward from the heat. I primarily use the Pocket Rocket Deluxe and found that the flame is too focused to cook evenly on the skillet. I was quite upset at first but came to accept that such a thin 8"" skillet would never be able to cook soft foods well on the average lightweight backpacking stove. It works a lot better on a stove with a broad burner and controlled simmer, I had very few issues with cooking on my gas stove at home. On the bright side, I have found this skillet to work quite well for grilling breads and tortillas. I've made bomb quesadillas and grilled sandwiches with it using some of my lighter stoves, the Pocket Rocket included. You still need a stove with a low simmer in order to use this skillet in any kind of way.
review.name: Expectations were too high.

name: Ceramic Camping Skillet

hasVariant.name: Focal 58L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Gregory Focal 58L Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I took this pack on a recent trip to the high alpine area of Southern Utah.   We hiked 15 miles and this pack carried 30lbs effortlessly.  I was a little worried carrying a "lightweight" pack since most of my life I have carried a traditional framed pack with all the zippers/pockets/organization you could ask for.   This pack did everything I needed and did it under 3lbs.   If you know what you are doing this is all you need for several days in the backcountry.
review.name: This pack is a home run

review.reviewBody: Bought the pack for 2-4 day backpacking trips in the Rockies. Overall, super happy with the pack — an order of magnitude lighter than my last, which I can definitely feel at the end of a long day. I regularly carry 30+ lbs (backpacking with kids) and it’s still comfortable. Only minor gripe that comes with the lightweight territory is a couple of small scrapes / holes in the bottom, despite always being conscious that it’s not bulletproof. Nonetheless, super happy and would buy again.
review.name: Lightweight pack for moving fast

review.reviewBody:
This pack feel so comfortable with my typical gear load of 25-30 Lbs! It doesn't have features like zippers and compartments as my other 4 Gregory packs, but over the years, I've been using those extra features less and less. I've used Exos and other cottage ultralight packs too, this pack is of course not ultralight, but to me, this pack is simply the best if one considers not only the weight, but all the factors: weight, features, ventilation, and comfort.

Unfortunately, with the M size that fits my torso well, I had to cinch the waist belt all the way to the end for my 30" waist size, although the description states the M belt fits down to 28" waist. Very sad this doesn't work for me as once I lose weight during long distance hikes, the waist belt will not work.  I also noticed Youtuber, Justin Outdoors, found exactly the same problem with the waist belt sizing in his Youtube video. Really hope Gregory could solve this size issue in future versions, it seems to me there is space for shifting and shortening the belt for ~2 inches, but I'm of course not a pack designer.

With this said, if you have a waist size of 33" or more with M size torso, I highly recommend you give this a try! You will be surprised how comfortable and ventilated you could get from such a lightweight backpack.
review.name: Could be the best but waist belt M size is off :(

review.reviewBody:
I purchased the Focal 58 to replace my circa 2000 Palisades.  While the Palisades still remains in excellent condition, I was looking for a more light weight pack.  I thought the Focal would meet my needs for a multi-day hike on the NPT.  Unfortunately, I ran into a durability issue almost immediately.  While making final adjustments to the pack, one of the upper clasps securing the side compression straps broke.  The bigger problem is that this clasp is permanently sewn into the pack so replacing it is not an option.  The clasp is so delicate it can not be repaired.  While this damage might seem minor the concern is the long term viability of the other clips and clasps are suspect.  On a brighter note the pack holds a fair amount of gear and carry’s between 25 to 30 pounds well. In addition all the pockets are really well thought out and useful.

I am 5’ 11” and about 185 lbs, my torso length is about 20”.  I tried both the medium and large and will both fit, the medium fit better in the shoulders.

While this pack carries well and is certainly light weight,  concerns for long term durability constrain me from wholeheartedly recommending this pack.
review.name: Light pack with durability issues

review.reviewBody: fantastic backpack all the straps you need. side mesh pockets are great size to hold a smart water bottle and still fit trekking poles. the ice axe strap is great for one axe. I am 5'9" and thin with like 30" waist and a small fit very good. As comfortable as my Baltoro 65 but half the weight. Carried 33 pounds very well. One gripe I have is that the chest strap slides up and down very easily, it does not stay in place, this was usually not irritating because it went to a place that did not bother me, however  this could be really annoying for some people
review.name: Excellent Overall

review.reviewBody:
Overall, I really enjoy this pack. Very lightweight compared to my previous 65L Atmos AG and it seems to hold weight just as well. In my opinion, it has just the right amount of features. I like having waist belt pockets, straps, and a way to attach hiking poles, but don't really care for extra pockets on the back or a separate sleeping bag access at the bottom like many packs have. 

The pack is very comfortable.... When it's sitting on my hips correctly. I bought the small because I have a smaller torso, and despite this I still fully max out the waist straps with my 31-32" waist. I cannot cinch it up any more. Because of this, I find it slowly slides down my hips and I have to readjust every so often. If you're waste is any smaller than mine, I don't recommend this pack. Other than that, it's a great pack.
review.name: Great pack with a flaw

review.reviewBody: I've been using the Gregory Baltero 65 for the last 10 years and have loved every minute with it!! Over the last 2 years I have started switching out some of my older gear for more ultra-light equipment and my pack was the last thing on the list. I tried The North Face Banchee 50, but the pack didn't fit my gear as well as the Baltero 65 did. Next I tried the Hyperlite, but the absence of a frame made it feel like a overloaded Jansport backpack from highschool, super uncomfortable. I also tried the Big Agnes Prospector 50.. and while that one showed promise, especially in the hipbelt, the upper straps were just too narrow and stiff making it uncomfortable on my shoulders. Enter the Focal 58. This pack fit all my gear in the exact same way I had it in the Baltero 65, even though it's 7 liters less.. it's Amazing!!! It weighs 2.5lbs lighter and has better airflow all around. The shoulder straps are way more comfortable even though they have way less padding than the Baltero 65, like how is that even possible?! But best of all, I like how this pack still has a frame, which distributes the weight flawlessly!! By far the most comfortable pack I've owned. Do yourself a favor and just get it!! You won't regret it!!
review.name: My New Favorite Pack!!!

review.reviewBody:
I have used my Gregory Focal 58 (Small) for up to 7 day wilderness backpacking trips and really like the size, weight and features of the pack. My wife also really likes her Facet 55, which is pretty much identical other than different sizing and colour.  All the pockets are really well thought out and well sized, even the hip belt pockets are a good size to be useful (and the zippers on them are easy to open and close, unlike my last pack). There have been no durability issues with the pack so far.  It took me a while to get used to the different balance of this pack from my previous packs because its weight is further off my back due to its mesh suspension. I can’t say that I really like this, but I think it is a worthwhile compromise given how much more comfortable the pack is on my back, especially in warmer weather. 

Smaller waisted people should be aware that Gregory’s hip belt specifications for the pack appear to be inaccurate. The pack specifications say it will fit a size 27" waist, I have a 30" waist and the Focal 58 size Small hip belt just barely fits me, I have it cinched in all the way, there is no further adjustment and no practical way that I can see to make it any shorter. My torso length is between the Small and Medium sizes so I also tried on a size Medium pack (specification is 28” waist) but the Medium hip belt didn’t fit me, it was too loose.

My other significant issue with the pack is that the shoulder straps seem to be a bit narrow and/or underpadded for me, they become uncomfortable on my collarbones after a short time wearing the loaded pack (up to 32lbs on a longer trip). Luckily the hip belt is extremely comfortable so I can stand to wear the pack on multi-day trips, and I like everything else about it enough that I have decided to put up with the shoulder strap discomfort and hope that eventually I’ll get used to them. 

Some other wishes for the pack are that it was available in a more visible colour, had a different arrangement for hanging the hydration bag (it’s an open hook so my non-Gregory hydration bag can unhook and slide to the bottom of the hydration pocket sometimes after I lay the pack down), had a clip in the main top pocket (I added one) like the one in the underside pocket, and had a shoulder strap hiking pole holder like my previous pack (I was able to add something similar on my Focal and on my wife's Facet).

Overall, I really like this backpack and recommend it, but would like to see Gregory modify the shoulder straps so they are more comfortable and (only significant for smaller waisted people) modify the hip belt so it can be shorter (but don’t make the hip belt pockets smaller!).
review.name: Excellent lightweight backpack, with some caveats

review.reviewBody: Purchased this pack to replace my Gregory Banshee from 1999 that is still functioning perfectly. I wanted something lighter to use for 5-7 day backpacking trips and this pack is perfect. I was able to pack six days of food and gear and push the load to 40 pounds and the pack performed beautifully with a very comfortable fit. I am 5'9" 165lbs and the Medium fits me perfectly. Love the hip belt pockets, the mesh opening on the back of the pack and the compression straps for the side pockets. Really well made pack that functions like a full size pack despite its ultralight nature.
review.name: Fantastic Pack

review.reviewBody: Light weight and comfortable! Only wish it had dual trekking pole holders (only on one side of pack).
review.name: 2lbs lighter than my Osprey

name: Focal 58L Backpack

review.reviewBody: These are really bad, especially for the price. Either the small chainring will snap when the bolts inevitably loosen, or the chainring will wear out at the same rate of the chain, expect to replace them often, with no support from easton.
review.name: Small chainring snaps off

review.reviewBody:
for the 47-32T, 46-36T, and 46-30T chainrings.  If you go to Easton's website, they have two categories of chainrings: "Shifting Rings", which are available in 53-39T, 52-36T, 50-34T, and "Gravel Rings", which are available in 47-32T, 46-36T, and 46-30T.  The image that CC is using for all of the chainrings is a picture of the Shifting Rings, which have different graphics than the Gravel Rings.   I purchased the 46-30T chainring, which has the number D40483 stamped on the small chainring.   I hope that info helps somebody that is looking to replace their Easton chainrings.

Unfortunately, I had to purchase a 46-30T replacement because I sheared off the 30T chainring on my Easton 46-30T combo while riding a steep trail while in my biggest 34T cog.   The chainrings were 1 month old.

To figure out what torque to use on my replacement chainrings, I emailed Raceface, and they told me that the torque spec for the bolt that holds the drive side crank arm to the left side crank arm is 50-60 Nm.
review.name: The image is incorrect...

name: EA90 Cinch Spider/Ring Assembly

review.reviewBody: Very nice but after wearing size 11,wich should normally fit I found my feet coming off the edges. I may try the size up. I wear size 10.5 shoe so 11 seemed like it should be right,so it seems the sizing is off.
review.name: Nice but sizing is off

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Every brand of shoe seems to be a little bit different and how it does it’s sizing. These shoes look nice and feel very comfortable, but the sizing is off a little bit. They are probably a size too big for my boyfriend, but they will still be usable for him especially in the summer time out at our pool
review.name: Looks good but run big

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Once you try these sandals you will never go back! These are BY FAR HANDS DOWN THE BEST SANDALS I HAVE EVER WORN! They fit and hug my foot perfectly, as well as they are soft yet strong. The color perfectly compliments any casual outfit. I especially love how the sole is thick and similar to that of an athletic shoe so that you have extra comfort with each step instead of feeling every thing such as rocks. You will not regret it! These are my new go to for summer comfort. Very well done!
review.name: All I can say is wow!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I got these for my husband for pool side and the beach. First off, the fit of the sandal is perfect. It cradles his foot perfectly. He says they are the most comfortable thong-type sandal he has ever worn. The leather is soft and strong, and the sandals are well made.
review.name: Well made and comfortable

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I got these for my husband and he loves them ! They’re perfect for days at the beach or casual nights out. He loves how comfortable they are and swears it’s almost like walking on air. They’re well made and have held up great so far. He’s looking forward to getting more pairs.
review.name: So comfy !

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I just started wearing the Olukai sandals by Tuahine last week. I wear a size 10 but probably could have went for a size 9. They are well built. I have high arches and these beautiful sandals hug my arches. The Tuahine symbol is embossed on the foot bed and the bottom of the sandal. They are ultra comfortable. I can't wait for the summer to get here so I can wear them to the beach and outside for long walks. I have the brown color which goes with jeans and shorts.
review.name: Comfy Sandals!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These olukai tuahine look and feel great. They seem to have a medium to wide fit and fit my feet great. My foot tends to be on the wider side but not wide enough for wide shoes. I would recommend these flops.
review.name: Looks and feel great

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I really like these sandals. I was heading on vacation to Florida and in need of a pair of new sandals, so I got these at a perfect time. They fit true to size and are very comfortable on the feet. I wore them both at the pool and walking around outside, and they work great for both. They really offer more support than most sandals. If you are looking for a new pair of sandals that are comfortable and have some support, I’d definitely recommend this product.
review.name: Excellent sandals

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Wow! I am very impressed by the quality of this sandals! I now understand why the price for this sandals. The materials used on this are very high quality. The leather is really nice and it fits like a glove! It is true to size. They really paid attention to every details on this sandals. The outsole is great. It has a very good traction. The footbed feels just right. It has the right amount of support and I can walk in this sandals for hours. Lastly, what I love about the Olukai brand is that they are focused on sustainability. I love how they care for the environment and that I will support. Overall, I am a fan and will definitely buy different designs in the future.
review.name: Top notch quality

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The best flip flops. They look great and are super comfortable. The neutral brown color goes with anything. So perfect from the pool, the beach, the boat to just hanging out. I think more comfortable than rainbows.
review.name: So comfortable!

name: Tuahine Flip Flop - Men's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I used this jacket for the first time 2 months ago in a ski trip to Whistler, BC. It was not crazy cold but I', a skier that prefers layering underneath as needed, and use a Goretex outer shell. I loved this jacket, it performed perfectly. Has a lot of well thought out and placed pockets, and is super comfortable. This past weekend, I took it to a camping trip in warm weather (fluctuated between 75 and 85 degrees celsius), but there was non-stop rain for 2 days. The jacket also worked perfectly, the Gore-Tex breathability did it's trick in the Warm Weather, and also kept me completely dry from the rain. Please note the neck line is high, super adequate for snowy/windy weather, maybe not as comfortable for warmer/wet weather... but I love the versatility. Also, jacket is slightly long down the waist and towards the legs, with I also like (personal fit preference) but for Snow and I found very useful in the wet weather as well.
review.name: Amazing Jacket for Snow and Rain

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great shell...a little thicker than some of my other shells. It perfect for the cold days
review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody: I bought this on for my son, and I thought it would have some insulation, but it's only the outer layer. Too expensive, I wouldn't buy it again
review.name: Too expensive for only one layer

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love the pattern and the oversized fit. I'm 6' tall and 175 lbs and the jacket is perfect, if not just a little long in the arms as other reviewers have pointed out. I don't like that there is no way to tuck the hood out of the way and I wish they had a better, softer, fluffier fabric by my chin when I have it fully strapped in. Also not sure the snow gaiter is going to work that well.
review.name: No

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Worldwide trademark impossible to say any mistakes or problem with a product. Constructive planned sequences for an all spectrum of deffending a weather attack. Best choice. Better wearing.
review.name: Highlightened and focused about a Summit Series

review.reviewBody: Brand new with tons of dark marks inside. Poor production quality and QC. See pictures for details. Keep in mind that is is fresh out of the package. And the packaging do suggest that it's brand new and has never been tried on.
review.name: Some quality issues, check images.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have no idea how people are saying this jacket isn't sized correctly. It fits like any other ski shell I have ever owned. Potentially people don't realize this is for skiing? Obviously too big for casual wear. Anyways, great jacket and I would highly recommend picking this up. North face has a great warranty and the shell performs well.
review.name: Sizing is correct

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fits perfectly and is comfortable
review.name: I would buy it for a friend

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It's funny, some of the reviews complain that this jacket runs too big. As a ski instructor and someone who has to be out in the cold all day, that's exactly what I wanted. You need to be able to wear lots of layers underneath. It's no fun being cold. This jacket is correctly sized.
review.name: Great jacket!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Protection for wind and snow is on another level, I would totally recommend this product
review.name: 10/10 Protection

name: Summit Verbier GTX Jacket - Men's
